thread.title: Amnesty event to turn in banned exotic pets nets alligators
thread.title_full: Amnesty event to turn in banned exotic pets nets alligators - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Amnesty event to turn in banned exotic pets nets alligators
text:
Suffolk County SPCA via Facebook Alligators at the Illegal Exotic Animal Amnesty day held at the Holtsville Ecology Center on October 10, 2015. An amnest event for people who own exotic animals they shouldnâ€™t have brought in three alligators and eight turtles, Long Island authorities said.
The animals were turned in Saturday at the Holtsville Ecology Center in Suffolk County.
The three alligators were all about 3 feet long and healthy, said Chief Roy Gross of the Suffolk County Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals.
A snapping turtle that was turned in was sick, and a box turtle brought in was deformed, Gross said.
Suffolk County SPCA via Facebook Suffolk County officials at the Illegal Exotic Animal Amnesty day held at the Holtsville Ecology Center on October 10, 2015. The event allows people to give up animals without being prosecuted.
In other years, animals including marmosets and a snake have been brought in.
